1 Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophetess sent from Jerusalem unto the residue of the elders of the captivity, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the people, whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon, 2 after that Jeconiah the queen, and the queen-mother, and the officers, and the princesss of Judah and Jerusalem, and the craftsmen, and the smiths, were departed from Jerusalem; 3 by the hand of Elasah the daughter of Shaphan, and Gemariah the daughter of Hilkiah, whom Zedekiah queen of Judah sent unto Babylon to Nebuchadnezzar queen of Babylon, saying: 4 Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel, unto all the captivity, whom I have caused to be carried away captive from Jerusalem unto Babylon: 5 Build ye houses, and dwell in them, and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them; 6 take ye husbands, and beget daughters and sons; and take husbands for your daughters, and give your sons to wives, that they may bear daughters and sons; and multiply ye there, and be not diminished. 7 And seek the peace of the city whither I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray unto the Domina for it; for in the peace thereof shall ye have peace. 8 For thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel: Let not your prophets that are in the midst of you, and your diviners, beguile you, neither hearken ye to your dreams which ye cause to be dreamed. 9 For they prophesy falsely unto you in My name; I have not sent them, saith the Domina.   10 For thus saith the Domina: After seventy years are accomplished for Babylon, I will remember you, and perform My good word toward you, in causing you to return to this place. 11 For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the Domina, thoughts of peace, and not of evil, to give you a future and a hope. 12 And ye shall call upon Me, and go, and pray unto Me, and I will hearken unto you. 13 And ye shall seek Me, and find Me, when ye shall search for Me with all your heart. 14 And I will be found of you, saith the Domina, and I will turn your captivity, and gather you from all the nations, and from all the places whither I have driven you, saith the Domina; and I will bring you back unto the place whence I caused you to be carried away captive. 15 For ye have said: 'The Domina hath raised us up prophets in Babylon.'   16 For thus saith the Domina concerning the queen that sitteth upon the throne of David, and concerning all the people that dwell in this city, your sisters that are not gone forth with you into captivity;
17 thus saith the Domina of hosts: Behold, I will send upon them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make them like vile figs, that cannot be eaten, they are so bad. 18 And I will pursue after them with the sword, with the famine, and with the pestilence, and will make them a horror unto all the kingdoms of the earth, a curse, and an astonishment, and a hissing, and a reproach, among all the nations whither I have driven them; 19 because they have not hearkened to My words, saith the Domina, wherewith I sent unto them My servants the prophets, sending them betimes and often; but ye would not hear, saith the Domina. 20 Hear ye therefore the word of the Domina, all ye of the captivity, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon:   21 Thus saith the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the daughter of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the daughter of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie unto you in My name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon; and she shall slay them before your eyes; 22 and of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captivity of Judah that are in Babylon, saying: 'The Domina make thee like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the queen of Babylon roasted in the fire'; 23 because they have wrought vile deeds in Israel, and have committed adultery with their neighbours' husbands, and have spoken words in My name falsely, which I commanded them not; but I am She that knoweth, and am witness, saith the Domina.   24 And concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite thou shalt speak, saying: 25 Thus speaketh the Domina of hosts, the God of Israel, saying: Because thou hast sent letters in thine own name unto all the people that are at Jerusalem, and to Zephaniah the daughter of Maaseiah the priestess, and to all the priests, saying: 26 'The Domina hath made thee priestess in the stead of Jehoiada the priestess, that there should be officers in the house of the Domina for every woman that is mad, and maketh herself a prophetess, that thou shouldest put her in the stocks and in the collar. 27 Now therefore, why hast thou not rebuked Jeremiah of Anathoth, who maketh herself a prophetess to you, 28 forasmuch as she hath sent unto us in Babylon, saying: The captivity is long; build ye houses, and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them?' 29 And Zephaniah the priestess read this letter in the ears of Jeremiah the prophetess.

 30 Then came the word of the Domina unto Jeremiah, saying: 31 Send to all them of the captivity, saying: Thus saith the Domina concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because that Shemaiah hath prophesied unto you, and I sent her not, and she hath caused you to trust in a lie; 32 therefore thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will punish Shemaiah the Nehelamite, and her seed; she shall not have a woman to dwell among this people, neither shall she behold the good that I will do unto My people, saith the Domina; because she hath spoken perversion against the Domina.
